newsitem.title: USA: FSA says Q3 muni bond volume up 146 pct.
newsitem.headline: FSA says Q3 muni bond volume up 146 pct.

text.p: Financial Security Assurance, a unit of Financial Security Assurance Holdings Ltd, said Tuesday it insured $3.2 billion of municipal bonds in the third quarter, a 146 percent rise over the same period last year.
In the third quarter of 1995, FSA and Capital Guaranty Insurance Co, which FSA acquired in December, insured a combined $1.3 billion of municipals.
For the year to date, FSA insured $8.2 billion of munis, a 91 percent increase over the $4.3 billion insured by FSA and Capital Guaranty in the first nine months of 1995.
FSA said it was the first quarter that the company outpaced Financial Guaranty Insurance Co, a unit of GE Capital Services, for a spot among the three largest municipal bond insurance companies.
GE Capital is a unit of General Electric Co.
AMBAC Indemnity Corp, a unit of AMBAC Inc, was the top insurer for the period, just ahead of MBIA Insurance Corp, a unit of MBIA Inc.
FSA also said Tuesday it insured $5.4 billion of asset-backed securities in the third quarter, compared to the $2.1 billion insured in the same period last year.
For the year to date, FSA insured $12.8 billion of asset-backed deals, compared to $6.8 billion in the first three quarters of 1995.
